msContents.summary: Trisagion followed by three Troparia; the texts are divided by crosses or chrisms

msItemStruct.note: 14 lines of writing on the front, back blank.
incomplete on the top, bottom right side; the top right portion was damaged by water and is completely obliterated

regular proficient hand inclined to the right, possible the hand of Moses. This writer wrote many texts, almost all biblical, in Coptic and biblical and liturgical in Greek (see Mon.Epiph. II 3, 7, 8, 15, 16, 19, 31, 32, 46, 47, 68, 400, 593, 600, 601, 603-607. Ostraca by the same scribe seem to be in the British Museum collection (e.g., Hall 1905, plate 20, 14030)
all the ostraca by this same scribe were found together on the palm-leaf sleeping mat which was on the floor of the cell
accents appear only in the biblical citations; most of the time they are incorrectly placed

provenance.p: from Thebes, Monastery of Epiphanius (Cell A). Property of the Metropolitan Museum, sold to Columbia University in 1961.
